task.title: SMTP with a Username and Password
task.shortdesc: Some servers require authentication. You can provide a username and password with setUsername() and setPassword().

context.p: To use a username and password with the SMTP Transport:

step.cmd: Call the setUsername() and setPassword() methods on the Transport.

result.p: Your username and password will be used to authenticate upon first connect when send() or batchSend() are first used on the Mailer.
If authentication fails, an Exception of type Swift_Transport_TransportException will be thrown.
result.note: If you need to know early whether or not authentication has failed and an Exception is going to be thrown, call the start() method on the created Transport.

example.codeblock:
<?php

require_once 'lib/swift_required.php';

//Create the Transport the call setUsername() and setPassword()
$transport = Swift_SmtpTransport::newInstance('smtp.example.org', 25)
  ->setUsername('username')
  ->setPassword('password')
  ;

//Create the Mailer using your created Transport
$mailer = Swift_Mailer::newInstance($transport);
